description: From Middle English waterrflod, from Old English wæterflōd, equivalent to water +‎ flood.

verbs.description: waterflood (third-person singular simple present waterfloods, present participle waterflooding, simple past and past participle waterflooded)

entries.meaning: To pump water into the ground around an oil well nearing depletion in order to loosen and force out additional oil.
examples: We will waterflood the well in order to obtain the remaining oil.
